title: Unknown imports appear randomly in wasm with wasm32-unknown-unknown

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
In the last ~6months imports are appearing in my wasm file that shouldn't be there

Sadly I can't post the full wasm file, but I'll post the relevant snippets from the wat file. 

```lisp
  (import "env" "_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h87bae2b944b06afaE.llvm.4648178200688082164" (func $_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h87bae2b944b06afaE.llvm.4648178200688082164 (type 6)))
  (import "env" "_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h82a2570e9881fedcE.llvm.8356378164814726448" (func $_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h82a2570e9881fedcE.llvm.8356378164814726448 (type 6)))
  (import "env" "_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h60586b0c4c0de6f8E.llvm.4648178200688082164" (func $_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h60586b0c4c0de6f8E.llvm.4648178200688082164 (type 6)))
  (import "env" "_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h863c201617f826e5E.llvm.4648178200688082164" (func $_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h863c201617f826e5E.llvm.4648178200688082164 (type 6)))

(func $_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h0aaec01cb045c974E (type 6) (param i32))
...
call $_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h9ada1f57a39a4b7eE
...
(func $_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h6a34fda5202dbbceE (type 6) (param i32))
```
None of the imports should have made it into the resulting wasm file.

Loading this into a wasm runtime, it will produce the following error

> Couldn't instantiate module -> Failed to create a module instance -> Failed to instantiate module -> unknown import: env::_ZN4core3ptr13drop_in_place17h87bae2b944b06afaE.llvm.4648178200688082164 has not been defined

Running `cargo clean` and recompiling will "fix" this issue, and makes the random import symbols go away.

This doesn't just happen with functions from core / std. I got the following error a few minutes ago

> Failed to instantiate module -> unknown import: `env::_ZN72_$LT$hashbrown..map..Keys$LT$K$C$V$GT$$u20$as$u20$core..clone..Clone$GT$5clone17hd616ebacd028a77eE` has not been defined`

But as far as I can tell, it can happen for any function in the code base.
## Setup

I am running into this issue several times a day now. I usually run `cargo watch -x "build --release --target wasm32-unknown-unknown"` with `export CARGO_INCREMENTAL=1`.

I am on arch linux with a ryzen5950x. I've been running into this issue for several months now. I think it has gotten worse recently since I upgraded from an 8 core to a 16 core cpu.

---

I understand that this will be a hard to reproduce issue. Is there any way I can provide more information? Any command you would like me to run when I encounter this issue again?
